ratings.comment: Gives good lectures. Notes are clear and with plenty of examples. Not too much HW and exams are pretty fair. Very good overall.
Good lecturer. Uses a lot of examples to cover material. Exam is fair.

Dong is a satisfactory teacher when he uses the board. If Dong uses his pre-made powerpoints, good luck. The powerpoints are dull and he does not explain the material on them at all. Do the homework, it is very helpful for when exam time comes.
He's terrible. "In other words, In other words" take any other professor if possible.

Literally the worst class I have ever taken. This was by far the hardest to get an A. Not because the material is hard, but because what is provided is nowhere near adequate to do well on the exams. Completely new things ALWAYS appear on exams. Get ready to visit a tutor, or anybody else who can actually teach because you WILL be on your own.

After getting through the calc sequence, you'd think stats would be a breeze... but no, this prof. manages to make a straightforward class complicated. With his strong accent in lecture, homework that is not helpful for tests, and incomplete practice exams, you'll be learning concepts as you take the exams, which may include topics never mentioned.

Dong makes Intro to Stats (normally an easy class) difficult and frustrating. His lectures are dry and pointless, since all he does is read off slides that he posts online anyways. Do all the homework and you'll understand just half of the exams. Exam prep is terrible, his "practice  problems"  do not represent his poorly written exams.
